org.texgen.textures.complex
Class Dirty

java.lang.Object
  org.texgen.textures.AbstractTexture
      org.texgen.textures.complex.Dirty
All Implemented Interfaces:
Texture
public class Dirty
extends AbstractTexture

Takes an input texture and color (default black) and dirties the source using a noisy texture

Author:
Andy Gibson

Constructor Detail

Dirty

public Dirty(Texture source)
Dirties the source texture with a solid black color

Parameters:
source - The texture to have dirty put over it Defaults the dirt to black with a speed of 0.5, a size of 10 and 10 octaves

Dirty

public Dirty(RGBAColor sourceCol)
Creates a texture which is black dirt over the source color.

Parameters:
sourceCol - Background color which is to be dirtied.

Dirty

public Dirty(RGBAColor sourceCol,
             double speed,
             int octaves,
             double size)
Creates a texture by dirtying a solid background of the given color using noise created using the noise parameters.

Parameters:
sourceCol - Background color to dirty.
speed - Rate at which the noise moves across the texture.
octaves - Number of frequencies to use when generating the fractal noise.
size - Value to scale the final dirt value by

Dirty

public Dirty(Texture source,
             RGBAColor color)
Dirties the source texture with the specified color

Parameters:
source - The texture to be dirtied
color - The color of the dirt

Dirty

public Dirty(Texture source,
             RGBAColor color,
             double speed)
Parameters:
source - The texture to be dirtied
color - The color of the dirty
speed - How fast the dirt changes across the surface (default 10)

Dirty

public Dirty(Texture source,
             RGBAColor color,
             double speed,
             int octaves,
             double size)
Dirties the source texture with the specified color using a noise function created from the parameters

Parameters:
source - The texture to be dirtied
color - The solid color to use to color the dirt
speed - Level of dirtying (default 0.5)
size - Rate that the noise moves across the texture
octaves - Number of octaves used to generate the noise

Dirty

public Dirty(RGBAColor sourceColor,
             RGBAColor color,
             double speed,
             int octaves,
             double size)
Dirties the source texture with the specified color using a noise function created from the parameters

Parameters:
source - The color to be dirtied
color - The solid color to use to color the dirt
speed - Level of dirtying (default 0.5)
size - Rate that the noise moves across the texture
octaves - Number of octaves used to generate the noise

Dirty

public Dirty(Texture source,
             Texture dirtTexture,
             double speed,
             int octaves,
             double size)
Dirties the source texture with the specified color based on the parameters used. Throws an exception if the source texture is null.

Parameters:
source - The texture to be dirtied
dirtTexture - The texture to use to color the dirt
speed - Level of dirtying (default 0.5)
octaves - Octaves used to generate the noise
size - Rate that the noise moves across the texture
Method Detail

getColor

public void getColor(double u,
                     double v,
                     RGBAColor value)
Description copied from interface: Texture
Calculates the color for co-ordinates u,v and puts the result in the RGBAColor value object passed in.

Parameters:
u - U component used to generate the texture
v - V Component used to generate the texture
value - RGBAColor object used to receive the result
